pages.text:
OVERVIEW
HIGH PERFORMANCE BUTTERFLY VALVE
Featuring Bray’s patented, award-winning design, this double offset high
performance butterfly valve is precision engineered to deliver quality, value,
and reliability in the most demanding applications
> Designed for high pressure, high temperature, and critical service applications
> Energized resilient seat design provides bidirectional zero-leakage shutoff
throughout full pressure range
> Dead-end service, with bidirectional sealing
> Firesafe design available
> Low fugitive emissions
> Metal seated control valve available
> Easy field maintenance
> Low torque requirements allow smaller actuators than other comparably rated
valve types
> Direct mounting of Bray actuators and controls provides a strong mechanical
connection and allows economical automation
> High cycle configuration available, rigorously tested to 1 million cycles
DOUBLE OFFSET STEM AND DISC DESIGN
The disc motion of the double offset design provides many
performance benefits: BODY
DISC OPENING
> Cam-action movement pulls disc away from seat
2nd OFFSET
> Reduces seat wear CENTERLINE DISC
OF VALVE
OPEN POSITION
> Disc does not contact seat
> Eliminates seat deformation
> Reduces operating torques
> Extends service life
DISC CLOSING CENTERLINE OF
SEAT CONTACT
> Linear motion pushes disc onto seat
> Wiping action prevents undesirable material buildup 1st OFFSET
INDUSTRIES APPLICATIONS MEDIA
> Air Separation > Mining > Caustic > Acids
> Chemical > Oilfield > Chilled Water > Alkalis
> Data Centers > Petrochemical > Pressure Swing > Corrosive Chemicals
> Electric Power > Petroleum Adsorption (PSA) > Dry Chlorine
Generation > Shipbuilding > Seawater (Gas or Liquid)
> Heating, Ventilation & > Water & Wastewater > Sour Gas (NACE) > Gases
Air Conditioning (HVAC) Treatment > Steam > Hydrogen
> Metal Processing > Vacuum > Oxygen
> Water

pages.text:
FEATURES & BENEFITS
DESIGN FEATURES
1 STEM DESIGN: High-strength, one-piece stem design is
standardized for interchangeability of Bray actuators
2 BLOWOUT-PROOF STEM: The stem retention design 1
does not rely on actuation components to prevent
stem blowout
3 ADJUSTABLE STEM PACKING: Easy access allows
simple quarter-turn field adjustments without actuator
removal 2 3
4 STEM SEAL SYSTEM: PTFE packing rings with carbon
fiber anti-extrusion ring provides constant compression
4
for a positive seal around the stem Options are available 10
for high temperature, high cycle and firesafe applications
5
5 STEM BEARINGS: Top and bottom bearings securely
support the stem, provide excellent corrosion 9
resistance, and minimize deflection from high
temperatures and mechanical loading forces 8
6 DISC: The disc is engineered to maximize flow and
minimize resistance for optimal flow rates
7
7 INTERNAL OVER-TRAVEL STOP: Designed to
minimize possible seat damage — extending the
service life of the seat
8 BIDIRECTIONAL RESILIENT SEAT: Provides 11
bidirectional zero-leakage sealing while isolating
the energizer from line media
6
9 FULL-FACED SEAT RETAINER: Cap screws located
outside sealing area are protected from corrosion
while allowing simple seat replacement
10 BODY: Extended neck allows access to stem packing
adjustments and actuator mounting when valve is fully
insulated
11 DEAD-END SERVICE: Lug and double-flanged bodies
are full rated for bidirectional dead-end service
5
Series 41 Lug Style

SEAT OPTIONS
RESILIENT SEAT DESIGN (STANDARD)
Bray’s unique, patented resilient seat design offers many exclusive advantages:
> Proven zero-leakage shutoff in both directions > Resilient energizer ring is fully encapsulated by the seat
> Interference-fit sealing, even when there is no differential and isolated from all line media contact
line pressure > Full-faced retainer secures seat in the correct position,
> Pressure-assisted sealing is energized by line media even without mating flange
pressure, providing a tighter seal in higher differential > Seat self-adjusts for wear and temperature changes,
pressure services providing longer service life
> Extended service life with reliable sealing after 1 million > Simplified seat replacement
cycles

FIRESAFE SEAT DESIGN METAL SEAT DESIGN
Bray’s firesafe design consists of the standard bidirectional resilient seat assembly Bray’s Inconel® metal seat provides
with added Inconel® metal seat With the valve closed, the firesafe seat assembly bidirectional FCI 70-2 Class IV leakage
contacts the disc with both the resilient seat and metal seat During and after a The seat and nitride hardened disc have
fire, when the resilient material has been partially or completely destroyed, the appropriate differences in hardness
metal seat provides a bidirectional seal by remaining in contact with the disc to eliminate the risk of valve damage
caused by galling
